title: Mobile Mathematics Problem-Solving Competency Enhancement Through Learning Design Decision Tracking

context.prior_knowledge: University-level foundational mathematics knowledge (functions, calculus, linear algebra, etc.)
context.additional_context: Mobile-based short-term intensive course for job seekers to cultivate practical mathematical problem-solving skills.

learning_goals: Using a LEED tracker, learners can analyze three types of mathematical problems (e.g., area calculation, resource allocation, cost estimation) occurring at construction sites, record solution processes in the tracker, and derive design decisions with ≥80% accuracy.
Learners can revise design decisions at least three times and incorporate feedback during a four-week design cycle

Learners can analyze three or more statistical datasets and two graphs collected in mobile environments, propose two mathematical approaches (regression analysis, probability modeling) suited to the given problem context, and explain the validity of each method with ≥80% accuracy.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
